data.text:
Amer Dzankovic Muhammad Ali: More than Just a Boxer

"Float like a Butterfly, Sting Like a Bee.”-Muhammad Ali. Muhammad Ali was born on January 17. 1942, in Louisville Kentucky. Muhammad developed a talent for boxing at a very young age and continued to strive to become better at it. Not only did he focus on himself and his career, but he helped out people in need by donating to charities and contributing to poor communities/people and the United Nations. He continued to battle with parkinson's disease throughout his life and he didn’t let it interfere with his passion towards boxing or living. Ali was a very famous african american boxer who had who had a determined, talented, and passionate soul.

Muhammad Ali had a determined soul. When …show more content…

Ali’s bike ,that was a gift from his father paid with his hard earned money, was stolen when he was 12 which lead him to finding his hidden talent. He went to a police officer named Joe Martin and told him that he wanted to “beat up the thief”, but the police officer replied that he needed to learn to fight before he got started challenging others. Martin was also a trainer for children who wanted to become boxers. Only about a year after training he won his first fight by making a very quick decision. Ali didn’t discover his talent until he was 12 years old. In fact, his talent developed after an incident occurred where he couldn’t defend himself, so he tried his best to get good at boxing. He did more than just this. His interest spread into a serious talent that soon the whole globe would realize. He strived to become better and shortly after, in 1956, he won the Golden Gloves tournament and in 3 years he would strive to win the National Golden Gloves Tournament of Champions. At only 14 years old he won the Golden Gloves tournament which means after only 2 years of training he was good enough to beat boxers that have been training their whole lives to achieve winning the same tournament. He earned a spot on the U.S olympic team in 1960 traveling around the world to become a more competitive boxer. 4 years after winning the Golden Gloves tournament, Ali was accepted by the olympics to compete for America. As shown, Ali’s career and …show more content…

Ali never gave up on winning his bouts and championships even in some of the darkest moments of his life and career. Ali was also very talented. His talent in boxing wasn’t revealed until he was 12, and shortly after he started training he started becoming a star. Lastly, Ali had a passionate soul for people that needed help living their lives in a safe, healthy, and normal way. He used his fame and money to contribute to those with health concerns and no roof over their heads. Ali died on June 3, 2016 from Parkinson’s disease. Muhammad Ali was the light at the end of the tunnel for many people around the globe, and shouldn’t only be remembered as a talented boxer but someone everyone should look up
